Fact.Description: If you're a K-12 educator, you can deduct up to $300 of unreimbursed expenses. If you're filing a joint tax return and both of you are educators, you can deduct up to $600, but each individual cannot deduct more than $300 per person. Qualified expenses include: Professional development courses Books, supplies, computer equipment (including related software and services) Other equipment, and supplementary materials that you use in the classroom
Lesser of the amount input by the taxpayer and the filing status limit
